Agencies.title: The Tabb Agency
Agencies.description: Talent agency in Oklahoma City for actors, models, and artists in film, TV, and print. Represents adults, youth, families, voiceover, and hair/makeup artists.

Agencies.title: Reel Talent Studio
Agencies.description: Talent agency in Tulsa. Film, TV, and commercial representation for adults, teens, kids, and voice-over.

Agencies.title: Linda Layman Agency
Agencies.description: Model and talent agency in Tulsa for over 50 years. Books actors, kids, and models for TV, print, film, and runway.

Casting.title: Freihofer Casting
Casting.description: Based in Norman. Casting Society of America (CSA) member. Casts film, TV, and commercials.

Classes & Workshops.title: Oklahoma Film Actors (OFA)
Classes & Workshops.description: On-camera scene study, workshops, and acting classes in the Oklahoma City Plaza District. First class free.

Classes & Workshops.title: The Actor Factory
Classes & Workshops.description: Acting studio in Norman since 2009. Adult and young performer classes: on-camera, audition for film & TV, scene work, demo reel camps. In-person and online.

Classes & Workshops.title: Cody Mayo Studios
Classes & Workshops.description: Film and TV acting conservatory in Tulsa. Adult and young actor classes, improv, private coaching, self-tape services. Studio Row, 317 S. Trenton Ave.

Classes & Workshops.title: OKC Improv
Classes & Workshops.description: Improv comedy classes in the Plaza District (1755 NW 16th St). Eight-week sessions, multiple levels from beginning to advanced; kids and teen classes, sketch and stand-up, and workshops. Supportive environment for building confidence and performance skills.

Networking.title: OKMPA Coffee with Crew
Networking.description: Free monthly film and TV industry networking by the Oklahoma Motion Picture Alliance (OKMPA). First Friday of every month, 8–10 a.m. Open to all—producers, crew, actors, students. OKC: Kamp's 1910 Café (10 NE 10th St, Suite 209). Tulsa: Circle Cinema (10 S Lewis Ave). Free coffee; board updates on legislation and industry news.
Networking.schedule: First Friday of each month, 8–10 a.m.

Networking.title: deadCenter Film
Networking.description: Oklahoma's largest and only Oscar-qualifying film festival, in OKC. Five-day fest each June; great place to meet filmmakers and connect with the local film community. Year-round screenings and education programs.

Photographers.title: Numunuu Photography
Photographers.description: Oklahoma City headshot studio in the Plaza District. Actor headshots and business headshots. Numunuu is Comanche for "the people".

Props.title: RANGE 405
Props.description: Prop firearms and armorer services for film in Oklahoma. Period and modern prop guns; armorer and actor weapons training; armorers available on set.

Stunts.title: 1907 Stunts by Justin Parks
Stunts.description: Stunt training and coordination. Justin Parks – stunt performer and instructor.

Studios & Sound Stages.title: Prairie Surf Studios
Studios & Sound Stages.description: Downtown Oklahoma City. 1.3 million square feet with five clearspan soundstages; converted from the former Cox Convention Center. Oklahoma Film + Music certified.

Studios & Sound Stages.title: Filmmakers Ranch
Studios & Sound Stages.description: About 15 miles from downtown OKC. 12-acre campus with three sound stages (23,000+ sq ft), six acres of backlot, standing sets (police station, hospital, high school, apartments), production offices, and Oklahoma's largest Grip & Electric company. Dolby Atmos post facility on site.

Studios & Sound Stages.title: Cherokee Film Studios
Studios & Sound Stages.description: Owasso campus, ~15–20 minutes from Tulsa. 27,000 sq ft complex with certified soundstages, XR/virtual production (LED volumes), edit suites, control room, audio booth, hair & makeup. Oklahoma Film + Music certified.

Studios & Sound Stages.title: Stormfront Studios
Studios & Sound Stages.description: Production facility in Tulsa's Kendall Whittier neighborhood. Two sound stages (6,000 and 2,800 sq ft), lighting grid, cyc walls, ADR/Foley booth, scene shop. 320-acre filming property in Osage County with cabin and exterior locations.

Theaters.title: Lyric Theatre of Oklahoma
Theaters.description: Oklahoma's official state theatre. Professional theatre in the Plaza District; also performs at Civic Center Music Hall. Thelma Gaylord Academy offers training.

Theaters.title: Carpenter Square Theatre
Theaters.description: Year-round live theatre at 1009 W. Reno. Modern works, comedy classics, and musicals. 120-seat venue with lobby art gallery.

Theaters.title: Jewel Box Theatre
Theaters.description: Longest continuously operating theatre in Oklahoma (since 1911). Six productions annually including plays and musicals. 301 NW 36th St.

Theaters.title: Oklahoma Shakespeare
Theaters.description: Classical theatre in the Paseo Arts District. Outdoor amphitheater and Black Box indoor theatre. Year-round season, student matinees, young company camps.

Theaters.title: 3rd Act Theatre Company
Theaters.description: Community theatre at The Shoppes at NorthPark (12040 N May Ave). Diverse, inclusive casting.

Theaters.title: World Stage Theatre Company
Theaters.description: Community theatre at 1130 S. Harvard. AACT and OCTA member. Season 8 (2025–2026) includes Lord of the Flies, For Colored Girls, and more.

Theaters.title: American Theatre Company
Theaters.description: Community theatre since 1970 at 3306 Charles Page Blvd. Four-play season, dinner theatre, Black Box, youth education, and local playwright opportunities.

Vendors.title: AMP Equipment
Vendors.description: Oklahoma film and camera equipment rental. Camera packages, lighting, grip, and production gear for features, TV, and commercials.
